headline: How Stronger Refining Margins and Heavier Crude Access Could Reshape Valero Energy’s (VLO) Risk–Reward Profile
summary: In the past quarter ended December 31, 2025, Valero Energy reported sales of US$30,372 million, with net income rising to US$1,134 million and basic earnings per share from continuing operations increasing to US$3.73. The results were powered by stronger refining margins and higher throughput volumes, highlighting how Valero’s refining configuration can benefit from access to heavier Venezuelan crude under evolving US policy. We’ll now examine how this rebound in refining margins reshapes...

headline: Murphy USA Q4 Earnings Beat Estimates as Fuel Margins Rise
summary: MUSA tops Q4 earnings estimates as fuel margins expand and merchandise sales rise, lifting total fuel contribution despite softer petroleum revenues.
